title: Karnataka ex-top cop found 'murdered' at home, 'wife prime suspect'
content: Former Karnataka DGP and IGP, Om Prakash, was found murdered at his Bengaluru residence on Sunday evening. Police Commissioner B Dayananda confirmed the death, stating Prakash was discovered in a pool of blood. His wife is the primary suspect, with initial reports suggesting stab wounds.

title: 'Muslim commissioner': Amid SC row, BJP's Dubey targets poll panel ex-chief
content: Following criticism of the Waqf (Amendment) Act, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey targeted former chief election commissioner S Y Quraishi, calling him a 'Muslim commissioner' and accusing him of facilitating Bangladeshi infiltrators' voter registration. This incident follows Dubey's controversial remarks about the Supreme Court and CJI, leading the BJP to distance itself from his statements questioning the court's authority.

title: 'Breach of orders': Israel accepts 'failure' in Gaza medics' killing
content: An Israeli military investigation revealed that the killing of 15 emergency responders in Gaza on March 23 was due to an “operational misunderstanding” and breaches of protocol. Troops mistakenly perceived a threat, leading to the tragic incident in Rafah's Tal al-Sultan area. Disciplinary actions include the dismissal of a battalion commander and reprimand for a brigade commander.

title: India likely to explore 'early tranche' in US trade deal
content: Indian trade negotiators are heading to Washington D.C. to explore an "early tranche" deal, potentially addressing a limited set of issues to expedite negotiations with the U.S. Both countries aim to finalize the agreement quickly, possibly before the fall deadline, while navigating regulatory hurdles like digital tax and reciprocal tariffs. Clarity is expected during U.S.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: 'Go home, have dinner with family ...'
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: Who is Ayush Mhatre, youngest to play for CSK?
content: Chennai Super Kings surprised everyone by debuting 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre, making him the youngest player in franchise history. Replacing the injured Ruturaj Gaikwad, Mhatre impressed in his debut against Mumbai Indians, showcasing his talent after being scouted during mid-season trials. His fearless approach and quickfire 22 off 7 balls have made him a player to watch.

title: Why Rohit Sharma not selected in MI playing XI
content: Rohit Sharma, despite a recent slump in form and a nagging knee injury, was benched for Mumbai Indians' match against Chennai Super Kings, potentially to be used as an Impact Substitute. After being felicitated for his 18th IPL season, Rohit's role is crucial for MI's comeback, especially with their current position outside the top four.

title: 'Throw my ashes ...': UP techie accuses wife of harassment, dies by suicide
content: Mohit Yadav, a 33-year-old techie from Uttar Pradesh, tragically died by suicide, alleging mental harassment by his wife and her family. In a video message, Yadav cited the lack of legal protection for men and accused his wife of demanding his property and forcing an abortion.

title: Lauren Sánchez gets $7k designer purse from Kardashians after space flight
content: Following Lauren Sánchez's Blue Origin space flight, Kris Jenner, Kim, and Khloé Kardashian gifted her a $6,995 Judith Leiber UFO handbag. The Kardashians supported Sánchez in Texas, praising the historic all-female mission. Sánchez also addressed the need for better-fitting spacesuits for women, collaborating with designers to create a suit specifically designed for women.

title: Uddhav & Raj Thackeray reunion on the cards? What BJP, Cong & NCP said
content: After two decades of estrangement, Uddhav and Raj Thackeray have hinted at a possible reconciliation, prioritizing Maharashtra's interests. Uddhav expressed his readiness to unite, while Raj emphasized that their differences are detrimental to the state and Marathi people. This potential reunion has garnered mixed reactions, with some welcoming it and others expressing skepticism about its impact.

title: Virat Kohli breaks record for most fifty-plus scores in IPL history
content: Virat Kohli's unbeaten 73 against Punjab Kings propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a comfortable seven-wicket victory. Kohli surpassed David Warner to claim the record for most fifty-plus scores in IPL history, reaching his 67th. Devdutt Padikkal's explosive 61 complemented Kohli's anchor innings, while disciplined bowling from Krunal Pandya and Suyash Sharma restricted Punjab Kings to a manageable total.

title: Former senior official criticises Andhra Pradesh government for its plan to operate 10 medical colleges under PPP mode
content: Development is not about building roads, buying luxury cars or showing GDP figures, but it is about ensuring that people across the State live healthy lives, he says

title: 775 die in calamities, 95 in fire mishaps in past two years in A.P.
content: APSDRF rescues 1,420 persons during the calamities, and the Fire Services Department officials save 29 people in fire fighting operations

title: Consumer welfare association pleads with govt. to reconstruct UPHC building in Nagapattinam
content: Although ₹1.2 crore was sanctioned under the National Health Mission for reconstruction of the buildingty, the work is yet to begin, says the association

title: Arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari opposes ED’s plea to declare him ‘fugitive’, calls his stay in U.K. legal
content: The High Court of Justice, London, U.K., in February allowed Bhandari’s appeal against his extradition to face charges of alleged tax evasion and money laundering. Bhandari claims his stay in the U.K. was legal since his extradition to India was denied by the London High Court.

title: Venugopal seeks action against BJP MP for ‘trying to intimidate Supreme Court’
content: He says open statements against judiciary will have serious consequences for democracy of our country

title: Congress-led Opposition alliance hits turbulence ahead of Assam panchayat polls
content: The grand old party reacts to Raijor Dal president and MLA Akhil Gogoi accusing MP Gaurav Gogoi and others of batting for the BJP

title: Gurdwara in Canada vandalised with pro-Khalistan graffiti
content: A Gurdwara in Vancouver was vandalized with pro-Khalistan graffiti, prompting an investigation by authorities. The Khalsa Diwan Society attributed the act to Sikh separatists, denouncing it as an attempt to sow division within the Canadian Sikh community. This incident follows a series of vandalisms targeting religious structures in Canada, including Hindu temples, raising concerns about rising extremism.

title: Blue Origin space flight: 'Big Kiss' that Kary Perry may be regretting
content: Katy Perry is reportedly reconsidering her involvement in the recent all-female Blue Origin space mission due to the intense backlash over its cost and perceived superficiality. The pop star regrets the post-flight theatrics, including kissing the ground and promoting her tour, which drew criticism from social media and fellow celebrities. Despite the negative reception, Perry maintains her commitment to environmentalism.

title: IPL: Virat Kohli leads with 73* as clinical RCB crush Punjab Kings
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Punjab Kings by seven wickets. RCB bowlers restricted Punjab to 157. Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 73. Devdutt Padikkal contributed a dazzling 61. Their 103-run partnership secured the victory. RCB has now won five away games. The team climbed to third place on the points table. It was a dominant performance by RCB.

title: Watch: RJ Mahvash caught clapping after Chahal smashed for 6
content: RJ Mahvash's enthusiastic applause for Devdutt Padikkal's six off Yuzvendra Chahal during an RCB innings has ignited social media. This reaction, captured on camera, adds fuel to the ongoing speculation about Mahvash and Chahal's relationship, especially considering her frequent support for Punjab Kings.

title: In Easter greetings, Trump rants against Biden & 'Left lunatics'
content: In his Easter message, Donald Trump criticized the 'Radical Left Lunatics,' 'weak' judges, and 'sleepy' Joe Biden. He accused the left of endangering the country by supporting criminals and slammed Biden's open border policy as a calamitous act. Trump also reiterated claims of a rigged 2020 election, wishing a sarcastic 'Happy Easter' to his political adversaries.

title: 'Yaha holiday manane aate hai': Sehwag slams IPL foreigners
content: Virender Sehwag has criticised Glenn Maxwell and Liam Livingstone for their lacklustre performances in IPL 2024, suggesting they lack the hunger to contribute meaningfully. Maxwell's poor batting form and Livingstone's inconsistency haven't justified their high price tags. Sehwag questions their commitment, implying they treat the IPL as a mere holiday, failing to deliver the expected impact for their respective teams.

title: Viral video: Preity Zinta spotted chatting with Rajeev Shukla
content: During an IPL match, Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, was seen in an engaging conversation with BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla, sparking social media buzz. While their discussion added intrigue off the field, the Punjab Kings struggled on the pitch, facing a batting collapse despite a promising start, ultimately managing only 157 for six.

title: 'Did he seek wife's permission?': Rane mocks Uddhav amid reunion rumours
content: Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane has ignited political speculation by asking Uddhav Thackeray if he took "his wife Rashmi Thackeray's permission" for a potential alliance with MNS chief Raj Thackeray. This comes amid hints from both Thackeray cousins about a possible reunion after 20 years, prioritising Maharashtra's interests. While Sanjay Raut acknowledges ongoing "emotional talks."

title: South African cheetahs Prabhash and Pavak relocated from MP's Kuno
content: Two South African cheetahs, Prabhash and Pavak, were released into Madhya Pradesh's Gandhi Sagar Sanctuary by Chief Minister Mohan Yadav on Sunday. The six-year-old males were originally translocated to Kuno National Park in February 2023. This relocation is part of Prime Minister Modi's initiative to reintroduce cheetahs to Asia. Kuno National Park currently houses 24 cheetahs, including 14 India-born cubs.

title: Yogi as PM?: Akhilesh Yadav's big claim on BJP plot for Maha Kumbh
content: Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of plotting to use the Maha Kumbh to promote Yogi Adityanath as a Prime Ministerial candidate and fostering societal division. This accusation follows BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's controversial remarks criticizing the Supreme Court, which the BJP has distanced itself from, emphasizing they were Dubey's personal views.

title: Renovation begins at Mannat, KL shares glimpse of bday celebrations: Top 5 news
content: Shah Rukh Khan's Mannat undergoes renovation, drawing fans. Rohit Shetty revealed Deepika Padukone's pregnancy during 'Singham Again' filming. Shaheen Bhatt's Instagram post sparked relationship rumors with Ishaan Mehra. Vikas Khanna defended Gauri Khan's restaurant against paneer allegations. Khushboo Patani rescued an abandoned baby girl, earning widespread praise for her courageous act in Bareilly.

title: Alien remains? Nasa's Perseverance rover spots skull-shaped structure on Mars
content: Nasa's Perseverance rover discovered a skull-shaped rock, dubbed "Skull Hill," in Mars' Jezero Crater, standing out against the lighter terrain. Chemical analysis ruled out meteorite composition, suggesting it might be an igneous rock transported by natural forces. Further tests are planned to determine its origin and age, leveraging the rover's analytical capabilities.

title: 'One temple, one cremation ground': RSS chief's call for social unity
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized social unity, advocating for shared resources and values to build a strong Hindu society. He urged members to engage with all communities to foster harmony. Meanwhile, Congress criticized the RSS and BJP, accusing them of dividing society and conspiring against marginalized groups through legislation like the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: Trump effect? Airfares to US from Delhi, Mumbai lowest in several summers
content: Airfares to the US have surprisingly decreased this summer, a trend attributed by some to US policies. Flights from Mumbai show the most significant drop, with one-way tickets to New York available for as low as Rs 37,000.

title: Russia and Ukraine accuse each other of breaching Easter truce
content: Russia and Ukraine trade accusations of truce violations during the Easter holiday. Despite a ceasefire announcement by Putin, both sides claim attacks. Zelensky reports increased shelling and drone use by Russia. Russia alleges repelled Ukrainian assaults and civilian casualties. Previous ceasefire attempts failed. Doubts linger about Russia's commitment to peace. Zelensky proposes extending the truce, but skepticism remains.

title: 'Without jurisdiction': Bhandari rejects ED's plea to declare him a 'fugitive'
content: Arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari is contesting the Enforcement Directorate's attempt to label him a "fugitive" in a black money case, arguing his UK stay is legal following a London court's denial of his extradition. The UK court cited concerns about his safety in Tihar jail and potential human rights violations.

title: Thousands protest in UK against Supreme Court ruling on definition of 'woman'
content: Thousands protested in London and Edinburgh against a UK Supreme Court ruling defining "woman" as assigned female at birth. Activists fear the decision impacts trans rights and access to single-sex spaces. The ruling stemmed from a dispute between the Scottish government and For Women Scotland over interpreting the Equality Act.

title: Education must reach the poor among all castes, says Siddaramaiah
content: Survey has produced empirical data that is essential to take up welfare and development programmes for all communities, says Chief Minister

title: Need for early diagnosis of kidney diseases stressed
content: Doctors talk of issues relating to kidney diseases at a transplant awareness event, where donors and survivors participated

title: Flash floods in Ramban: J&K CM Abdullah, L-G Sinha grieve rain-related deaths; assure relief, assistance to those affected
content: “My thoughts are with the affected families in this difficult hour. We are in touch with the local administration to ensure immediate rescue efforts wherever needed. Later today, I will be reviewing restoration, relief, and repair plans,” J&K CM Omar Abdullah said

title: Apollo Hospital, ‘fake’ cardiologist booked for MP, Chhattisgarh Assembly Speaker’s 2006 death
content: Yadav charged with criminal homicide for posing as a cardiologist, conducting cardiac procedures on former Speaker in 2006; Apollo Hospital management also booked for not checking his certificates

title: Counselling for rowdy-sheeters conducted in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Police conducts cordon and search operations all over the district and vehicle-checks at Tadimarri, Kadiri Rural, and Dharmavaram station limits

title: Kerala Waqf Board to oppose Waqf Amendment Act before Supreme Court, State govt. yet to take a call
content: M.K. Sakeer says board has drawn up a statement detailing its stance and will file it before the apex court on Monday

title: Osmania University Arts College becomes the 3rd registered trademarked building in India
content: TThe university now holds exclusive rights over the use of the building’s image for any commercial purpose, protecting it from unauthorised replication and branding

title: Farmers continue to press for modernisation of  Thenperambur dam
content: Despite its significance, the dam continues to rely on manually operated shutters to regulate water flow — unlike modern structures such as Kallanai, where electrically operated actuators are in place

title: Telangana Fire Service Week 2025 concludes with a 5K run
content: The Fire Service Week campaign featured extensive outreach activities, including demonstrations, fire drills, training sessions, and educational lectures conducted across various types of premises, ranging from hospitals and industries to residential colonies and commercial establishments

title: India deploys MiG-29, Jaguar jets for multi-nation Desert Flag exercise in UAE
content: India has deployed MiG-29 and Jaguar fighter jets for the 'Desert Flag' exercise in the UAE, showcasing its commitment to strengthening defense ties with friendly nations. The exercise aims to enhance interoperability and exchange operational knowledge with air forces from the US, UK, and other countries. This participation underscores India's focus on military cooperation and defense-industrial collaboration in the region.

title: Husband spots 'missing' wife with another man at Taj Mahal
content: A man in Uttar Pradesh discovered his missing wife had eloped after spotting her in a WhatsApp video taken at the Taj Mahal. Shakir returned home to find his wife, Anjum, and their four children gone, prompting him to file a missing person report.

title: Pakistani Hindu minister attacked during protest in Sindh
content: Pakistani Hindu state minister Kheal Das Kohistani faced an attack in Sindh due to protests against federal canal projects, which are perceived as a threat to the province's water share. Demonstrators targeted his motorcade with tomatoes and potatoes, prompting swift condemnation from federal and provincial authorities.

title: Azharuddin to move court against HCA ombudsman’s order
content: Mohammad Azharuddin plans to challenge the HCA Ombudsman's order in Telangana High Court, which directs the removal of his name from a stadium stand. He alleges the order is invalid, claiming the ombudsman's tenure had expired. Azharuddin accuses the current HCA administration of targeting him for opposing corruption and disrespecting players, while also refuting claims of removing VVS Laxman's name.

title: When Raj Thackeray left Shiv Sena in 2005: 20 years later, Uddhav says 'let's talk'
content: In 2005, Maharashtra witnessed Raj Thackeray's dramatic exit from Shiv Sena, citing disrespect and marking a significant family and political split. Uddhav Thackeray, while expressing sadness, affirmed Shiv Sena's resilience and commitment to its goals.

title: Why did Pope Francis not officially meet JD Vance in Rome?
content: Vice President JD Vance's Rome visit saw him meeting Cardinal Parolin, discussing war, humanitarian crises, and Church-state cooperation, notably migrants, refugees, and prisoners. Only a brief greeting with Pope Francis reportedly occurred, despite the Pope's recent recovery from pneumonia. Tensions remain high, highlighted by differing views on migration and Vance's past accusations against the Church's migrant advocacy.

title: 2nd B'desh embankment near Tripura border triggers security & flood fears
content: Bangladesh's embankment construction near the Muhuri River in South Tripura, allegedly violating the Indira-Mujib pact, has raised security and flood concerns. Over 500 families fear monsoon flooding. CPM legislator from Belonia Dipankar Sen sought immediate intervention of the Union home ministry into the issue, as similar incidents in Kailashahar earlier prompted India to build higher embankments to counter flood risks.

title: Abhinav Shukla, kin receive threats from person claiming to be part of Bishnoi gang
content: Abhinav Shukla, an actor, got a death threat online. The threat came from someone claiming to be a fan of Asim Riaz. The person also claimed affiliation with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The message threatened violence against Abhinav and his family. Abhinav shared the threat publicly. Tensions between Rubina Dilaik and Asim Riaz on a reality show are also mentioned.

title: Why jeans have tiny pockets
content: The tiny pocket in jeans, dating back to 1873, was originally designed for cowboys to store pocket watches safely. While wristwatches made it obsolete, the pocket remains an iconic symbol of traditional denim construction. Today, people repurpose it for small items, valuing its heritage and enduring style in a world of fast fashion.

title: 'Mickey Mouse is smarter’: Economist Jeffrey Sachs mocks Trump over tariff policy
content: Jeffrey Sachs has strongly criticized Donald Trump's trade policies, deeming them "delusional" and economically damaging. Sachs estimates a $10 trillion loss in global wealth due to Trump's strategies, highlighting the president's misunderstanding of trade deficits and his imposition of tariffs based on flawed logic. He also points to automation, not trade, as the primary cause of manufacturing job losses.

title: 'Nahi crying': Pooran’s heartwarming moment with Avesh’s mother. Watch!
content: Avesh Khan's match-winning performance for Lucknow Super Giants was followed by a heartwarming video call with his mother, showcasing the emotional side of cricket. Nicholas Pooran's playful interaction with Avesh's mother, comforting her tears with lighthearted words, highlighted the team's unity and the deep connection between players and their families.

title: How to master Yutori: Japanese secret of longevity and happiness
content: Yutori doesn’t promise perfection or instant peace. But it offers something just as valuable—a reminder that slowing down can be a strength. In a busy world, making space to breathe might just be the most powerful step toward lasting happiness and health. It's not about having more time. It’s about using time more wisely—with softness, awareness, and care.

title: 'Nitish changes parties just for kursi’: Kharge targets BJP and JD(U) alliance
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge launched a scathing attack on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and the BJP in Buxar, denouncing their alliance as opportunistic. Kharge accused Kumar of frequently switching sides for power and alleged the BJP-JD(U) government failed Bihar, highlighting PM Modi's unfulfilled promise of a special package.

title: ‘Opposition cannot complain against reports by Backward Classes Commissions’
content: Chairpersons and members of the commissions were appointed by H.D. Kumaraswamy, B.S. Yediyurappa and Basavaraj Bommai, says Minister

title: Exfoliating dead skin
content: The Centre intends to establish a leather industry cluster in Ramaipur, Kanpur, where British-era tanning trade once flourished along the banks of the river Ganga. Mayank Kumar reports on the hope and desperation of tannery owners and workers in the Uttar Pradesh district coping with the loss of business and increased costs due to a 2017 government order, and concerns over pollution raised by the National Green Tribunal

title: Government allocates five anchorages in Kollam for Muthalapozhy fishers cut off from sea due to siltation of harbour mouth
content: The government has secured five fish landing centres with mooring facilities in Kollam. From Monday, fishers from Muthalapozhy could dock their sea-faring boats at Jonakapuram, Vadi, Muthakkara, Port Kollam, and Thankassery anchorages and resume operations

title: 16 militants arrested in Manipur, arms recovered
content: Two cadres of the banned United National Liberation Front (Pambei) were apprehended from Napetpalli Andro road near Nongdam village in Imphal East district on Saturday (April 19, 2025)

title: Bhashyam students excel in JEE Main 2025
content: G. Sai Manogna of the institute has emerged as all-India female topper with a 100 percentile of marks, says institute chairman Bhashyam Ramakrishna

title: Six soldiers injured in road accident in J&K’s Udhampur
content: The accident occurred near Chopra market in the town, 65 km away from Jammu, when a bus carrying the soldiers was on its way to a nearby camp, officials said

title: 'Like prime Yuvraj': England batter hails Vaibhav Suryavanshi's IPL debut
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the youngest IPL debutant at 14, made a stunning entry. Representing Rajasthan Royals, he hit a six off his first ball against Lucknow Super Giants. He scored 34 runs with three sixes and two fours. Sam Billings compared his bat swing to Yuvraj Singh. Suryavanshi's performance justified the hype surrounding his selection.

title: Delhi building collapse: Homes and many lives crumbled like cards
content: A building collapse in Mustafabad turned a wedding preparation into tragedy for the Ahmad family, claiming the lives of Danish, the sole breadwinner, and his brother Naved. The disaster also injured Shahid Ahmad, his wife Rehana, and daughter Neha, leaving the family devastated and financially insecure.

title: Kerala’s Intellectual Property Rights policy to be revised after 17 years
content: Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment constitutes six-member drafting committee. IPR policy of 2008 will undergo comprehensive revision in line with the new and emerging demands in the area

title: Two cheetahs get new home in Madhya Pradesh’s Gandhi Sagar Sanctuary
content: Cheetahs Prabhas and Pawak were relocated from the Kuno National Park, expanding their habitat in India

title: ISRO satellites forecast wheat production
content: The eight major wheat-growing states are Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Bihar, Gujarat and Maharashtra

title: Village Revenue Officer assaulted for stopping illegal gravel transportation in Chittoor district
content: The revenue officials led by the police seize seven tractors and two excavators; the police form a special party to nab the accused

title: ‘Voice of Kinnaur’ community radio launched in Himachal’s border district
content: The grassroots platform set up under the Indian Army’s Operation Sadbhavana will deliver local news and crucial public interest information, and content on education, health, and regional culture

title: South Central Railway GM inspects works at Secunderabad railway station
content: SCR GM Arun Kumar Jain inspects Secunderabad Station redevelopment progress, emphasises safety, security, and passenger amenities for hassle-free travel

title: Sebi finds no manufacturing at Gensol’s Pune EV plant, only 2-3 labourers
content: During a site visit to the facility on April 9, an NSE official found only two to three labourers present

title: Hyderabad’s Christian community welcomes Easter with sunrise services and songs of Hope
content: Churches filled with worshippers, hymns echoing, families celebrating with faith, food, and togetherness on the occassion of Easter Sunday in Secunderabad

title: Watch: Karnataka caste survey | Controversy within Congress party
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss the controversy Karnataka over caste survey report within the Congress party

title: AIKS to stage protests against U.S. Vice President Vance's visit to India
content: It said the ongoing trade negotiation is a deliberate move so that cheaper cotton, soybean, maize, apple etc. from the United States can be dumped in India, which it warned would lead to a price crash for Indian farmers.

title: Urinated on, sexually assaulted by two men, alleges Dalit youth in Rajasthan
content: The victim alleged that the accused also recorded a video of their acts and "threatened" to share it on social media if he told anyone about the incident; the accused also used casteist slurs

title: Murshidabad violence: NCW chief urges West Bengal government to address grievances of riot-hit people
content: Advocating confidence-building measures by the State administration, NCW chief Vijaya Rahatkar said “responsibility in bringing in peace lies with the State government”

title: Supreme Court lawyer seeks contempt proceedings against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey
content: In his letter to the attorney general, advocate Anas Tanveer said Dubey's remarks are "deeply derogatory and dangerously provocative".

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu’s birthday: TDP leaders cut 75kg cake at party’s central office
content: TDP leaders said CM Naidu was like a God to the masses, whose welfare had always been on the top of his mind

title: Ahead of Vance visit, Congress asks if PM will convey India’s concerns to the U.S.
content: The Opposition party raised the issues of the manner of deportation of Indian citizens, the breakdown in WTO’s multilateral rules-based trading system, and the U.S.’s withdrawal from the WHO and the Paris Agreement

title: Animals in Tirupati Zoo get respite from heat wave
content: As is the practice every year during this part of summer, the zoo management has made elaborate arrangements to help the animals withstand the heat. Efforts are made to maintain the room temperature between 28C and 29C

title: Nine held in massive engine theft from Kia Motors' plant in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Penukonda court remanded the accused to 14 days of judicial custody, as police continue to investigate the large-scale theft that has shocked the auto industry.

title: JD(U)-BJP alliance ‘opportunistic’; Nitish Kumar switches sides for kursi, alleges Congress chief Kharge
content: Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that Constitution is under continuous attack and the BJP government wants to intimidate the Opposition but the Congress is not scared of anyone

title: Climate experts seek 'right to cool', heat protection for informal sector workers during summer
content: In its seasonal outlook, the IMD warned that the number of heatwave days this summer might be significantly higher than usual, especially over Rajasthan, Gujarat, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and western Madhya Pradesh.

title: Karnataka caste-survey findings: Will of political party, leadership key to implement social justice, says Congress leader Raju
content: “When reservation was being debated in the Constituent Assembly, it wasn’t smooth sailing even then,” said K. Raju, a permanent invitee to the CWC

title: Police excess: SHRC recommends Tamil Nadu Government to pay compensation of ₹50,000
content: SHRC member V. Kannadasan also recommended the State Government to recover the sum from the policewoman as per the rules

title: Minister reviews execution of drinking water projects in Chidambaram
content: About 71% of the works have been completed, he said, adding that the combined drinking water supply scheme will benefit a total of 1,27,566 persons in Chidambaram municipality, Annamalai Nagar Town Panchayat and 10 Panchayats.

title: One of prime accused in murder of father-son in riot-hit Murshidabad held
content: Sheikh was arrested by the Special Task Force (STF) of the West Bengal Police along with the Special Investigating Team (SIT) from his hideout in Chopra in Uttar Dinajpur district

title: Five feared dead as cloudbursts, landslides damage property, highways in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Vehicular movement on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway was stopped from both sides due to landslides, mudslides and shooting stones at multiple places between Nashri and Banihal

title: Two persons duped of ₹77.6 lakh in medical college admission fraud; six booked
content: A man from Chhattisgarh alleged that the six accused promised to get his daughter a postgraduate seat in General Surgery course at a reputed Nerul-based medical college.

title: Janivara row: Forest Minister Eshwara Khandre offers free seat to Suchivrat Kulkarni at BKIT
content: The BKIT is the flagship institution of Shanti Vardhak Education Society, Bhalki, to which Eshwara Khandre is the chairman

title: Samajwadi Party can never be 'true well-wisher' of Dalits due to flaws in its intentions, policies: Mayawati
content: The Samajwadi Party is trying to spoil it in every way to fulfil its narrow political interests, says Mayawati

title: Six arrested for betting on IPL matches in Andhra Pradesh
content: Cases have been registered against the six persons under the newly introduced Organised crime sections of BNS Act and Gaming Act

title: U.S. Vice-President JD Vance to cover Delhi, Jaipur and Agra during official visit to India
content: On Tuesday, April 22, Mr. Vance will travel to Jaipur, while on Wednesday, April 23, Mr. Vance will visit Agra. Concluding his visit, Vice President Vance will depart from India on Thursday, April 24, at 6.40 a.m.

title: Sealdah Division to allow male passengers in Matribhumi locals reserved for female
content: According to Sealdah Division, it has been closely monitoring the occupancy in Matribhumi locals and noticed that these ladies special trains were not running with full capacity. The augmentation of infrastructure with trains with 12 car EMU rakes from earlier 9 car EMU rakes will make Railways serve passengers better

title: News in Frames | Threads of tradition
content: Many tribal communities in Assam are actively adopting hand-woven bags that serve as both an essential utility item and a symbol of cultural identity

title: Legwold ranks the 100 best draft prospects: An annual list of the top names to know
content: Jeff Legwold reveals his top prospect list, which is based purely on ability regardless of position. Who is No. 1?

title: Redick: Wolves' 'physicality' caught us off guard
content: The Lakers acknowledged after Saturday's 117-95 loss in Game 1 that they were wholly unready for the raw, bruising physicality of the Wolves.

title: Knicks go on 21-0 run as miscues tank Pistons
content: The Knicks, down as much as eight in the fourth quarter, went on a 21-0 run to take control of Game 1 vs. the Pistons.

title: Russ' 'attack mode' stings Clips, lifts Denver in OT
content: With the Clippers practically daring him to beat them, Russell Westbrook came up big at the end of regulation and again in overtime for the Nuggets, who roared back from a 15-point deficit to beat the Clippers 112-110 in overtime in Game 1.

title: Deion eyes QBs, not ceremony, in CU spring game
content: Former Colorado players Shedeur Sanders and Travis Hunter had their jerseys retired Saturday before Colorado's spring game.

title: Lewandowski (hamstring) in doubt for UCL semis
content: Robert Lewandowski is a major doubt for the Copa del Rey final and the Champions League semifinal after Barcelona confirmed the striker has a hamstring injury.

title: Berrios confronts Raleigh, suspects pitch tipping
content: Jose Berrios, Saturday's starter for the Toronto Blue Jays, suspected Seattle Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh was relaying pitch information to his teammates and wanted him to know what he thought of it, exchanging words with him after the fourth inning.

title: MacKinnon keys Avs' win over Stars in Game 1
content: Nathan MacKinnon scored two goals and assisted on another as the Colorado Avalanche opened their NHL playoffs with a 5-1 win over the Dallas Stars.

title: Missouri State safety dies in possible gun mishap
content: Todric McGee, a 21-year-old safety at Missouri State, died Saturday from a possible accidental gunshot wound.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Previewing Sunday's three Game 1s
content: Six teams begin their playoff journeys Sunday. Here's what to watch, plus Saturday's results and Three Stars.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: 'How do we get better?' How Padres' October disappointment inspired 2025 success
content: The Padres were a win away from knocking out the Dodgers last year. Now, they're determined to come back even stronger -- even against the defending champs.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: USWNT's Rodman out indefinitely with back injury
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has been ruled out indefinitely by the Washington Spirit as she continues to manage an ongoing back injury, the NWSL team confirmed to ESPN.

title: Barça net 'unbelievable' win, fear for Lewandowski
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick lauded Barcelona's "unbelievable" comeback against Celta Vigo as the "best feeling" after Raphinha's stoppage time penalty sealed a vital 4-3 win for the LaLiga leaders.

title: Inter Miami wins in front of record Crew crowd
content: Benjamin Cremaschi scored on a diving header in the 30th minute and Inter Miami beat the Columbus Crew 1-0 on Saturday.

title: Bundesliga history made with 8 goals in 1st half
content: Union Berlin and VfB Stuttgart made history on Saturday as the first Bundesliga game to feature eight goals before halftime.

title: Villa's Watkins: I was 'fuming' at PSG benching
content: Recalled Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins took out his anger on Newcastle United on Saturday with a dazzling display in his side's 4-1 victory in the Premier League.

title: Coach: Celta player target of racist slurs at Barça
content: Celta Vigo midfielder Ilaix Moriba was targeted by racist insults from Barcelona fans after their La Liga game on Saturday, his coach said.

title: Lyon strike late to edge Arsenal in UWCL semi
content: Kadi Diani and Melchie Dumornay handed Arsenal a rare defeat at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday as Lyon opened the Women's Champions League semifinal tie with a 2-1 win.

title: USMNT's Richards sent off in Palace draw
content: Bournemouth had to settle for a 0-0 draw against Crystal Palace in the Premier League at Selhurst Park on Saturday, with the hosts having been reduced to 10 men late in the first half after defender Chris Richards was sent off for a second yellow card.

title: What's on the masks of 2025 Stanley Cup playoff goalies? Our guide to all 16 teams
content: The 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are underway and it's the drip in goal that could potentially steal the show.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Former champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. is the right opponent for Jake Paul
content: Chavez's best day are in his rearview mirror, but this matchup is a big step up in competition for Paul.

title: "What A Debut": Sundar Pichai's Shout-Out To Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: An audacious first-ball six by a 14-year-old, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, on his Indian Premier League (IPL) debut earned him huge praise all around. One among those admirers was Sundar Pichai, the chief executive of tech giant Google.

title: Israel Army Probe Says No "Indiscriminate Fire" In Killing Of Gaza Medics
content: An Israeli military investigation concluded Sunday that its troops did not use "indiscriminate fire" in an incident that killed 15 Gaza emergency service personnel, but acknowledged failures and announced plans to dismiss a field commander.

title: Liberals Vs Conservatives: Where Things Stand In Canada Polls 2025
content: With the 2025 Canada elections around the corner, Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberal Party continues to maintain a lead in voting intentions over rival Conservatives led by Pierre Poilievre.

title: Samajwadi Party To Fight 2027 UP Polls With INDIA Bloc? Akhilesh Yadav Says...
content: Mr Yadav said that the "PDA (Backward, Dalits, and Minorities) would uproot the BJP" from the state in the 2027 assembly elections.

title: Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport, 1 Runway Working, Other Under Repair
content: Flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport faced a delay today after the authorities shut one runway for repairs.

title: Woman Sentenced To 20 Years Imprisonment For Sexually Assaulting Teen In Rajasthan
content: A POCSO court in Bundi sentenced a woman to 20 years imprisonment for kidnapping and sexually assaulting a 17-year-old boy in October 2023, officials said.

title: India-US Trade Pact, Global Issues: Top Agendas Of JD Vance's India Visit
content: US Vice-President JD Vance begins his four-day India visit on Monday with focus on a trade agreement, bilateral relations and the implementation of the outcomes of the India-US joint statement issued in February.

title: Delhi Records Highest Minimum Temperature In 3 Years
content: Delhi recorded its highest minimum temperature in three years on Sunday with the mercury settling at 26 degrees Celsius, 4.4 degrees above the season's average.

title: UP Teen Killed After Falling Into Well. Was Fleeing After Fight At Wedding
content: A dispute arose between factions within the wedding party regarding the selection of songs to be played by the DJ, the police said.

title: Who Is Yves-Francois Blanchet, The Quebec Voice In Canadian Polls
content: In the lead-up to the April 28 Canadian federal elections, all eyes are once again on Quebec - a province with a unique political identity and the power to sway the national balance of power.

title: 'Lost Everything In One Night': J&K's Ramban Residents After Landslides
content: Residents in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban are assessing the damage due to landslides triggered by heavy hailstorm, with many saying they have lost commercial property and homes.

title: Heavy Rain In J&K's Ramban Triggers Flash Flood, Over 100 Rescued
content: More than 100 people were rescued after heavy rain triggered a flash flood in a village in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district early on Sunday, officials said.

title: How Death In A Cinema Hall Paved The Way For Raj Thackeray's Shiv Sena Exit
content: In the early 1990s, Shiv Sena, led by its firebrand leader Bal Thackeray, had grown into a formidable political force in Maharashtra. During those days, two young men would accompany Bal Thackeray to public events

title: Posing As Trustees, 5 Collected Rent From Shops On Waqf Land, Arrested
content: Five persons have been arrested for allegedly posing as trustees and collecting rents for 17 years for structures built on land owned by two Ahmedabad-based trusts registered under the state Waqf Board, police said on Sunday.

title: Dalit Man, 19, Thrashed, Urinated Upon, Sexually Assaulted In Rajasthan
content: He was out watching a wedding procession in Rajasthan. Two men called him to a nearby bus stand. Without provocation or warning, they then thrashed him, urinated upon him and sexually assaulted the 19-year-old Dalit man, said the police.

title: Gensol Misled Investors, No Manufacturing At Pune EV Plant: SEBI
content: Sebi has prohibited Gensol and its promoters -- Jaggi brothers - from accessing the securities market until further notice.

title: Meet Jagmeet Singh, Whose Impact On Canada Polls Can No Longer Be Ignored
content: Jagmeet Singh is once again on the ballot, pushing bold promises, a progressive agenda, and the hope that Canadians are ready for more than just the usual political dance.

title: Indian, Chinese Students Join Forces To Sue Trump Administration Over F-1 Visa Termination
content: Three Indian students studying in the US have joined forces with two others from China to legally challenge the Trump administration over F-1 student visa terminations of "thousands of international students."

title: Wanted Militant Of Meitei Armed Group PLA Arrested In Assam Hotel Raid
content: A wanted member of the People's Liberation Army (PLA), a banned Meitei militant outfit, has been arrested by the Guwahati Police from a hotel in the city's Paltan Bazaar neighbourhood.
